guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for brexpiprazole and CYP2D6

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily D member 6

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302132

text.html: NO action is required for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: The gene variation results in a reduction of the exposure to brexpiprazole, but there are no indications supporting a decrease in efficacy.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302136

text.html: NO action is required for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: The gene variation results in a reduction of the exposure to brexpiprazole, but there are no indications supporting a decrease in efficacy.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302123

text.html: NO action is required for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: There are indications supporting an increase in the exposure to brexpiprazole, but no indications supporting an increase in side effects in patients with this gene variation.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302127

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for brexpiprazole in normal metabolizers.

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on brexpiprazole.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302121
implications: The risk of side effects is theoretically increased, because the gene variation reduces the metabolism of brexpiprazole.

citations.title: Dutch Pharmacogenetics Working Group (DPWG) guideline for the gene-drug interaction between CYP2D6, CYP3A4 and CYP1A2 and antipsychotics.
